title: Great Company
pros: Takes care of their employees
cons: Growth depends on industry compression

title: Typical corporate work
pros: Half day Fridays and Monday + Friday WFH
cons: Cubicle corposlop office, they sat me next to absolutely nobody and it sucked. Benefits are meh at best, company culture is very boring and corporate. Comp is low for being in SD, one of the most expensive places in America.

title: Sad how the company has chaged
pros: The people who care and want the company to succeed. The benefits are good.
cons: The general counsel, chief legal officer doesn't know how to manage the dept. She says one thing one day and something totally different the next day, causing confusion and frustration. She doesn't have the company's best interest at heart.

title: Terrible culture
pros: None at the present moment.
cons: GC/CLO does not know how to manage. Terrible environment

title: Great Place; Wonderful Work-Life Balance
pros: Excellent environment, amenities, culture and balancing hours.
cons: Can't think of any! I loved it.

title: Great company and culture
pros: Fully covered benefits, stock opportunity, 5 hour Fridays, career opportunity.
cons: 401k plan could increase match and quicker vesting

title: Overall Good Company
pros: Half days on Friday and good benefits.
cons: Below market compensation and high employee turnover.

title: Okay Experience
pros: Remote work was a huge benefit. Work/life balance is a priority across the company, managers are understanding of home life.
cons: Pay is lower than most other companies of its size. Work load is very large per manager, hard to keep up.

title: Good place to work
pros: good work experience, half day Fridays, the people
cons: Below market Compensation and benefits, high work load

title: Tread carefully
pros: Top-notch benefits and PTO Nice offices/workspaces
cons: The company has grown so fast that workloads are unmanageable and unsustainable workloads. Leadership is unwilling to hire more people to cover the additional work (or claim there are "hiring freezes" when there actually aren't). Hourly employees work off the clock regularly to barely stay afloat and are expected not to complain about it. Leadership then gets upset when people are behind on their work. Communication is very top-down and executives do not take real concerns (e.g., unsustainable workloads and low pay) seriously. They claim they are listening via engagement surveys and town halls, then say they don't understand why people are unhappy. Employees have been leaving in droves. Below-market pay across the board. The benefits are outstanding so they tout this as why they can pay less. No accountability for poorly performing employees After COVID, departments were allowed to choose when their teams were required to be in the office (if at all), plus many people were hired as fully remote during the pandemic. The office was mostly empty most of the time when I was there so there was no real sense of team culture.

title: Great People
pros: I feel there are so many good people who are kind, respectful, smart, supportive. Also the work is challenging.
cons: Real estate work is sort of feast or famine.

title: Good Health Insurance
pros: Companie pays full insurance coverage for employees.
cons: Employees pays partial coverage for dependents.

title: Was really a great place with smart people... don't like corportate
pros: Great people with a lot of knowledge
cons: It felt very corporate which wasn't for me

title: Zero Work/Life Balance
pros: In general, the company still has a small firm feeling despite being a Fortune 500 company. It's easy to make connections with people in other departments, and Realty Income hosts many employee-friendly events. The insurance benefits are great, and the CEO is very communicative and accessible to employees.
cons: Work expectations are outrageous. It's like public accounting busy season all year with the hours required. Expect to work late nights and weekends all year long.

title: Great Company
pros: Can work remotely, ability to work in areas that you're inspired by.
cons: Fast Growth, Getting help with IT is difficult and can lead to making it difficult to get job done, disorganized management style with lack of communication, long closing times

title: Great company
pros: 35 hour work week, engaged leadership
cons: Sometimes information travels slowly between internal departments

title: solid place
pros: Good people, try to make it a good place for everyone.
cons: Things move slow, pay is meh

title: Great
pros: Great place to work and great career path
cons: Can’t think of any at the moment

title: Great company
pros: Great culture, many amazing people. The company is dedicated to its employees and has good benefits.
cons: Pay is not consistent with market salaries.

title: Great Job
pros: Administrative postion that is remote. Small company so I do have many diverse responsiblities
cons: Working 7 days a week if needed

title: Executive leadership does not care about employees
pros: Good benefits but pay is very low for the industry
cons: Executive leadership is showing it does not care about its employees. Even though we have a hybrid schedule, HR reps walk the halls to tattle to the CEO if people are not always at their desks. Long-time employees and leaders are leaving in droves. I am truly worried for the success of the company. The executives care about having people at their desks at the expense of everything else. Throughout the pandemic, employees of every level proved themselves by working hard and breaking productivity records and company financial success. Also throughout the pandemic, the CEO promised we would have continued flexibility after the pandemic, but that is proving not to be the case. Employees have thrived and adapted through a merger and a pandemic, enduring great stress and change, and the company does not care about the employees. The company will not succeed if it does not start listening. The co-workers that haven’t yet left are all searching for other work, and approximately half of the company already has no idea how to do their job. Working here is utter chaos. It will be even worse if the executives do not change and listen.

title: Excellent Company with Growth Opportunities
pros: The company has great benefits and you are only required to work half days on Fridays, so every weekend feels like a three day weekend to me! There is fresh fruit provided in the kitchen on Mondays & Wednesdays, quarterly company luncheons, fun company outings and baking competitions, etc. I've worked for many companies who didn't value their employees, so I really appreciate working for this company and how they really seem to care about the well-being of the staff. They have a weekly boot-camp workout at lunch available, and have offered weekly yoga class and meditation classes in the conference room since I've worked here. Average tenure is around 6 years, I've witnessed many coworkers who have celebrated their 5, 10, 15 and 20 year work anniversaries in the past year that I've been here as well.
cons: The departments do not communicate very efficiently, and usually one department has no clue what any other is doing, but I am hoping that information will be more easily accessible cross-departmentally once the new property management system is in place.

title: Turning Into Not the Best Place to Work
pros: Great Health Benefits and Generous PTO
cons: Company morale is low and upper management doesn’t listen to their employees. You can see how the company has morphed from a great family feel to a corporate giant that doesn’t seem to care as much about their employees and only cares about the bottom line. Employees are overworked and expected to take on extra workload as the company grows too fast for teams to handle which leads to people scrambling to complete their work and many people working long hours. Base compensation is low compared to other companies. They will pay more for outside talent instead of employees who prove their worth and has been at the company for years. They are not flexible with remote work and employees are expected to be in the office 3 times a week even though some employees are provided with full time remote opportunities. If you’re an exempt employee, half day Fridays don’t mean anything because you are still expected to work to meet tight deadlines. More long term employees have been leaving.

title: Growing company but low compensation
pros: Great benefits, work/life balance is fair, nice people, job security
cons: Total compensation is not competitive at any level below VP. Salaries for tenured employees are often less than new hires because they have trouble hiring talent at what they pay their current employees that have been around for 5+ years. Turnover increasing every year. Top talent is leaving to get paid double somewhere else and the company seems to be ok with not paying to keep top performers. It has gotten very corporate; lots of new hires all the time and culture is non-existent anymore. Realty Income has loss all sense of the family feel it once represented and now is solely about growth at the expense of keeping overhead and salaries at a minimum.

title: Poor Company Culture
pros: Great benefits and half day Friday’s.
cons: Poor company culture. Upper management doesn’t take constructive feedback from employees to improve anything. Departments don’t communicate with each other and there is a lot of disorganization when it comes to proper procedures. There is no work life balance. Company team building events can be uncomfortable and feel forced. There is no dedicated trainer for the company so if you get hired remotely be prepared to sink or swim. I’ve seen some employees work remotely while others were forced to return to the office after two years of working remotely. We also were given a return to work date probably 6 times and it kept getting rescheduled so each time your life had to pause and reset not knowing if this was the time we really had to go back. HR didn’t seem to care that they were inconveniencing everyone repeatedly. There is a lot of office politics, more than normal. Their practices are not fair and a lot of people are quitting.

title: Highly undervalued and underpaid
pros: Half day Fridays, benefits, PTO
cons: Workers are grossly underpaid for the workload and amount of hours needed to meet strict deadlines. There is a revolving door on analysts. Most have a life expectancy of 1-2 years before moving onto a company that pays fairly (sometimes almost double). Not to mention, you are required to return to office even though it’s impossible to live on their analyst salary in San Diego. As for the company as a whole, long-time employees have left and are continuing to leave due to management’s disregard for their employees. The company has changed from a successful, “family feel” with some of the best talent to a culture-less corporate machine. Used to be a great company but unfortunately it is going downhill.

title: A place to grow a career
pros: The company pays for medical benefits, has 5 hour Fridays and is growing very rapidly. If you are willing to put in the effort to learn, you will be rewarded greatly. Your career is a conversation here. The CEO is authentic and Realty will continue to be a leader in commercial real estate. Cost of capital makes the difference in this space and Realty has one of, if not the lowest- which allows us to create value for our shareholders that others can't. I'm newer to the company after a merger and I'm impressed and I'm picky!
cons: Post merger growing pains are still being sorted through but for the most part were well handled and the company will be more efficient once the dust settles.

title: Looks good on paper, but avoid this company if possible
pros: Fair pay 100% employer paid medical premium (might go away soon) Short day Fridays Company itself is doing well; very stable
cons: Execs are detached from the business No department knows what another department is doing Most decisions made at the management level are politically-charged Not a team-oriented environment. Often hostile, with clashing personalities People hoard information for power, making everyone else's job more difficult Low morale

title: The company is comprised of a great group of people!
pros: Employer paid 100% benefits Nice Solid business model Everyone smiles, are generally happy, and are respectful Family centered Fair pay Long term employees, not a lot of turn over Management and HR are cool
cons: The only negative thing is you have to have your butt in seat at 8am, generally old school time fixated.

title: Horrible Micromanagement
pros: Free candy, coffee and bananas
cons: You will not learn anything here unless you do not already know how to be a data entry clerk and scribe filling out spreadsheets and forms under hypercritical scrutiny. If you did not attend an elite school and are not still under 35 years old forget about getting ahead here. The environment is superficially nice while everyone fears making suggestions let alone decisions, because independent thinking is not allowed. It is a very repressive regime.

title: Excellent Place to work
pros: Great place to work. Company cares about their employees and working hard is rewarded. I feel very appreciated and fairly compensated.
cons: Organizational change management was poorly handled but they have taken steps to improve this from the top down. I personally would like more social events to connect team members but understand it has been difficult to facilitate this in recent years.

title: Disrespect, lack of transparency, and unprofessional management
pros: Good employees at the mid-senior level.
cons: manager did not respect women or minorities. Over seven people quit from under him and there was no accountability or action towards him. This is a theme I have seen across the company and experienced myself. I quit after 6 months of working in the Phoenix office due to the incredibly unprofessional work environment, the lack of regard for employees, and the constant empty promises.

title: Going the Wrong Direction
pros: Good Health benefits and generous PTO policy
cons: Very low pay, subtract a couple thousand if you are unvaccinated or not boosted. This will be a fully vaccinated company in a year. Upper management very concerned about keeping G&A expenses low. Employee morale lowest in years. Be cautious if you're just starting at this company.

title: Current Employee who is recently hired and find the company to be the epitome of professionalism, respect, and integrity
pros: Great employees who are so incredibly nice!!! Committed to the company.
cons: I can't find any cons yet

title: Great Company
pros: stable company great employees, everyone is friendly, and willing to work as a team not too big, you can get to know everyone in the company pretty well positive leadership and clear direction amazing benefits
cons: can't really think of anything

title: Great place to work!
pros: Good pay and benefits (PTO, healthcare, stock options, half-day fridays). Work can be a lot at times but I do feel overall there is a nice work/life balance. Colleagues and upper management are all hard working, respectful, and happy to be working at Realty Income.
cons: None that I can think of currently

title: Great company with good perks
pros: Great benefits (especially if you stay long enough for stock options), half-day Fridays are amazing and I actually think are more productive because you can book dentist appts and things like that on Friday, and nice co-workers!
cons: Not a lot of communications among teams, which creates some awkward meetings.

title: Exceptional Organization
pros: Wonderfully ethical employer, dedicated to leading the industry and developing top tier talent within the organization. Extremely conscientious of work life balance, and a gestalt approach to the employer/employee relationship.
cons: The work flow is geared towards the tech-savvy. Multiple digital platforms and programs drive daily work.

title: Good Place To Work
pros: Good benefits, half day Fridays, company events, good team.
cons: Company changed with the new CEO that came in 2014. Brought all his Wall Street friends as execs and that began to slowly change the culture. Wage growth seemed slow compared to other companies.

title: Great Organization
pros: Great benefits, PTO, and culture. People are genuine and want to see each other succeed.
cons: Work-life balance isn't as apparent. Pretty conservative company overall, not as receptive to new ideas or change.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Flex hours on Fridays; healthy portfolios and budgets; incredible employee gatherings; nice people.
cons: Leadership team was in top-down transition; mass amounts of change; some positions were "revolving doors"

title: Great Organization Overall
pros: Flexible Schedule Remote Opportunities Good Environment Open Door Policy
cons: Can feel very corporate Base Pay is below MV

title: Great Company
pros: - Very experienced and knowledgable senior management team - Upward mobility within the organization - Care about their employees - Generous PTO package - Half day Fridays
cons: No cons to write about.

title: Great Company to Work For
pros: -Growing company -Excellent Leadership from Senior Management -Friendly, team oriented culture -Work life balance

title: Great experience for investment analysis
pros: Great hands-on experience with deals and investment analysis/research on a wide range of industries
cons: Compensation lower than other investment analysis firms/positions

title: Horribly robotic

cons: Every job is clerical or data entry. There is no autonomy or independent thought permitted. Micromanagement in the extreme.
